results.title: Effect of metformin in autistic BTBR T + Itpr3tf/J mice administered a high-fat diet.
results.text_hl: HFD consumption markedly aggravated @DISEASE_Mental_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@repetitive behaviors@@@ in the self-grooming test. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ reduced HFD-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperactivity@@@.

citations.NLM: Deng W, Li F, Ke H, Wang S, Li Z, Lv P, Chen Y. Effect of metformin in autistic BTBR T + Itpr3tf/J mice administered a high-fat diet. Brain Res Bull. 2022 Jun 1;183():172-183. PMID: 35240246
citations.BibTeX: @article{35240246, title={Effect of metformin in autistic BTBR T + Itpr3tf/J mice administered a high-fat diet.}, author={Deng W and Li F and Ke H and Wang S and Li Z and Lv P and Chen Y}, journal={Brain Res Bull}, volume={183}, pages={172-183}}

results.title: Movement disorders related to antidiabetic medications: a real-world pharmacovigilance study.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Among 11,729 cases of motor adverse events in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@DM@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, six categories of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Complications @DISEASE_MESH:D048909 @@@drMD@@@ were significantly associated with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@DM@@@ medications. Noticeably, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was revealed to drastically increase the incidence of @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease_Secondary @DISEASE_MESH:D010302 @@@parkinsonism@@@ (adjusted ROR:3.97; 95 %CI (3.03, 5.19), p = 5.68e-24), @DISEASE_Hypokinesia @DISEASE_MESH:D018476 @@@bradykinesia@@@ (adjusted ROR:1.69; 95 %CI (1.07,2.59), p = 0.02) and irregular @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinesia@@@, including @DISEASE_Chorea @DISEASE_MESH:D002819 @@@chorea@@@, @DISEASE_Choreoathetosis_Hypothyroidism_And_Neonatal_Respiratory_Distress @DISEASE_MESH:C567034 @@@choreoathetosis@@@ and @DISEASE_Athetosis @DISEASE_MESH:D001264 @@@athetosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhao Y, Fei L, Duan Y. Movement disorders related to antidiabetic medications: a real-world pharmacovigilance study. Prog Neuropsychopharmacol Biol Psychiatry. 2024 Aug 22;135():111128. PMID: 39181309
citations.BibTeX: @article{39181309, title={Movement disorders related to antidiabetic medications: a real-world pharmacovigilance study.}, author={Zhao Y and Fei L and Duan Y}, journal={Prog Neuropsychopharmacol Biol Psychiatry}, volume={135}, pages={111128}}

results.title: Metformin treatment in young children with fragile X syndrome
results.text_hl: Previously, a case series of children and adults with @DISEASE_Fragile_X_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D005600 @@@FXS@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ demonstrated improvements in @DISEASE_Mental_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D001523 @@@irritability@@@, social responsiveness, language, and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkinesis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperactivity@@@.

citations.NLM: Biag HMB, Potter LA, Wilkins V, Afzal S, Rosvall A, Salcedo-Arellano MJ, Rajaratnam A, Manzano-Nunez R, Schneider A, Tassone F, Rivera SM, Hagerman RJ. Metformin treatment in young children with fragile X syndrome Mol Genet Genomic Med. 2019 Nov;7(11):e956. PMID: 31520524
citations.BibTeX: @article{31520524, title={Metformin treatment in young children with fragile X syndrome}, author={Biag HMB and Potter LA and Wilkins V and Afzal S and Rosvall A and Salcedo-Arellano MJ and Rajaratnam A and Manzano-Nunez R and Schneider A and Tassone F and Rivera SM and Hagerman RJ}, journal={Mol Genet Genomic Med}, volume={7}, number={11}, pages={e956}}

results.title: Metformin as targeted treatment in fragile X syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ as targeted treatment in @DISEASE_Fragile_X_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D005600 @@@fragile X syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Dy ABC, Tassone F, Eldeeb M, Salcedo-Arellano MJ, Tartaglia N, Hagerman R. Metformin as targeted treatment in fragile X syndrome. Clin Genet. 2018 Feb;93(2):216-222. PMID: 28436599
